sections.description:
Comprehensive WordPress plugin that restricts user registration to whitelisted email domains with email verification, analytics dashboard, and Ultimate Member integration.

Key Features

  • Domain Whitelisting: Control who can register by specifying approved email domains
  • Wildcard Support: Use *.example.com to allow all subdomains
  • Email Verification: Verify user email addresses before allowing login (single-site)
  • Analytics Dashboard: Visual statistics with Chart.js including success rates, trends, and activity patterns
  • Registration Logging: Track all registration attempts with detailed information
  • Ultimate Member Integration: Full compatibility with UM registration forms
  • Bulk Management: Import/export domain lists via CSV
  • Multisite Compatible: Works on both single-site and multisite installations
sections.installation:
Automatic Installation

  1. Go to WordPress Admin > Plugins > Add New
  2. Search for "Email Domain Restriction"
  3. Click "Install Now" and then "Activate"

Manual Installation

  1. Download the plugin ZIP file from codeeffina.com
  2. Go to WordPress Admin > Plugins > Add New
  3. Click "Upload Plugin" at the top
  4. Select the ZIP file and click "Install Now"
  5. Click "Activate Plugin"

Initial Setup

  1. After activation, go to Email Domain Restriction in the admin menu
  2. Click "Domain Whitelist" to add your first approved domain
  3. Configure settings as needed in the Settings tab
  4. Test registration with a whitelisted and non-whitelisted email

sections.faq:
Can I use wildcards for subdomains?

Yes! Use *.example.com to allow all subdomains like user@sub.example.com, user@another.example.com, etc.

Does this work with Ultimate Member?

Yes! The plugin includes full Ultimate Member integration. Domain validation works automatically on all UM registration forms, and the plugin intelligently handles email verification to avoid conflicts with UM's built-in system.

Will this work with WooCommerce or BuddyPress?

Yes, the plugin hooks into WordPress core registration which these plugins use.

How do I export my domain list?

Go to Email Domain Restriction > Domain Whitelist and click the "Download CSV" button at the bottom of the page.

Can I customize the error message shown to blocked users?

Yes, go to Email Domain Restriction > Settings and edit the "Blocked Domain Message" field.

Does this work on multisite?

Yes, it works on both single-site and multisite WordPress installations.

How long are registration attempts kept in the log?

By default, logs are kept for 30 days. You can adjust this in Settings under "Log Retention Period".

Where can I get support?

Visit the plugin homepage or check the GitHub repository.
